title: The left settings, chat etc. window covers the half of the screen and it's not resonsive
body:
**Describe the bug**
The left settings, chat etc. window covers the half of the screen when Teams is not maximized and it's not resonsive. The only way to fix it is to clear storige but after you exit Teams on the second start it's again like that. 


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Just start Teams

**Expected behavior**
The left pane should be responsive as it was after a few weeks.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
![Screenshot_2024_02_09_14_48](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a65e48fd-1978-4a96-a52c-9da227888fb3)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
Operating System: Arch Linux 
KDE Plasma Version: 6.1.4
KDE Frameworks Version: 6.5.0
Qt Version: 6.7.2
Kernel Version: 6.10.6-arch1-1 (64-bit)
Graphics Platform: X11
Processors: 32 × Intel® Core™ i9-14900KF
Memory: 62.6 GiB of RAM
Graphics Processor: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090/PCIe/SSE2
Manufacturer: ASUS

**Debug**
When possible, please run the application from the terminal using `--webDebug` and try to reproduce the error.

The provide in this section the output from both the terminal and the browser debug console.

```bash
teams-for-linux --webDebug --logConfig='{}'
```
Terminal output:
https://pastebin.com/vafEqMaf

Teams browser debug console:
I don't know how to get it, there are too many elements and I don't know which one is needed but if you tell me I'll be happy to provide it.
